description:
A Link Between Worlds is a game in the classic Legend of Zelda series,
and a sequel to A Link to the Past. Explore dungeons, fight monsters,
discover magical items, and save the worlds of Hyrule and Lorule!

v0.1.2.description:
**Note**: The installation instructions have changed: now you put the albwrandomizer *folder* in the lib folder. If you have an albwrandomizer *file* from a previous version, remove it.

Changes
- Starting weapon cannot be placed in sand rod slot
- Lamp and net do not count as starting weapons unless "Lamp and Net as Weapons" is on
- "Minigames Excluded" option now also excludes maiamai inside Rupee Rush
- Swamp Palace and Eastern Palace weather vanes randomize correctly when vanes are shuffled
- Fix bug where items get sent when starting a new save
- Bogus error messages no longer appear in client
- Game no longer crashes in credits
- Compatibility with Python 3.12 and Mac OS
- Update to latest version of upstream randomizer, meaning Premium Milk crash is fixed, and Ravio now tells you how many portraits are required
v0.1.2.title: v0.1.2

v0.1.3.description:
Changes
- Implement Chest Size Matches Contents option
- Implement Crack Shuffle option
- Speed up collection of junk items
- Ravio only generates hints for progression or useful items
- Fix crash when emulator is opened while connected to the multiworld
- Options added to slot data
- Patcher opens a console window
v0.1.3.title: v0.1.3

v0.1.4.description:
**Installation Note**: The albwrandomizer library is now included in the apworld and does not need to be installed separately.

- Update to work on AP 0.6.5
- Add support for playing on 3DS (@LittleCube-hax, @hatkirby)
v0.1.4.title: v0.1.4

v0.1.5.description:
- Fixes a bug that can prevent the apworld from loading
- The client can be launched by a desktop shortcut

This version is compatible with games generated on 0.1.3 and 0.1.4.
v0.1.5.title: v0.1.5
